title: Corrupted system files making you lose lp? sounds fair.
body: I just bugsplatted off of corrupted system files, that were not detected upon initially opening the game, but only after i was already condemned to losing my lp. Why is there not an instant feedback between the patcher and the server communicating corrupted files found, that prevent me from relogging? It feels hecka bad to lose tons of lp for something that not only is not my fault, but could also be prevented by a simple instant feedback feature. No reason to punish people at random is there?

replies.body:
Disconnecting from a match has a negative impact on everyone in it, regardless of the reason for the disconnection. This is a key reason why [the system](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752714-LeaverBuster-FAQ) treats all disconnections equally and any penalties associated cannot be removed or modified.

There are a lot of potential causes for bugsplats. They could be caused by driver or system issues, hardware issues or an issue with the League installation. Our [Bugsplat guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974-Bug-Splat-and-Game-Crashes) will address the most common solutions for this issue.

Please let me know if you still have issues after working through the guide.

Happened again directly 6.18, and i've been told that it's happened to other windows 10 users after patches. Issue is Finding corrupted game files directly on game entry. (after load or directly after entering the game). My windows is 100% updated always. so i don't believe that's the issue.

It sounds like your installation may be completely borked and a clean reinstallation of League may be necessary. 

I recommend grabbing our [Hextech Repair Tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) to complete this. Start the app, check the boxes for both **Reinstall** and **clean uninstall**, then allow the process to run for a while. After the reinstallation has finished, launch League to finish patching to complete the process. I strongly recommend installing League to the default directory **(C:\Riot Games\League of Legends)**.

Let me know if this helped resolve the corruption issues.

Repair the game by clicking the question mark icon to the top right of the patcher. Select "Repair" and let the patcher scan and repair corrupt game files. When the process is completed, you'll see the orange "Launch" button.
